etymologies: mid 16th century (as a Scots legal term, denoting a document presented by a writer to the Signet): from medieval Latin signatura ‘sign manual’ (in late Latin denoting a marking on sheep), from Latin signare ‘to sign, mark’

definitions: a person's name written in a distinctive way as a form of identification in authorizing a check or document or concluding a letter

examples.text: the signature of a senior manager

shortDefinitions: person's name written in distinctive way as form of identification

definitions: the action of signing a document

examples.text: the license was sent to the customer for signature

definitions: a distinctive pattern, product, or characteristic by which someone or something can be identified

examples.text: the chef produced the pâté that was his signature

crossReferenceMarkers: short for key signature or time signature

definitions: a letter or figure printed at the foot of one or more pages of each sheet of a book as a guide in binding.
shortDefinitions: letter or figure printed at foot of one or more pages of each sheet of book as guide

definitions: a printed sheet after being folded to form a group of pages.
shortDefinitions: printed sheet after being folded to form group of pages

definitions: the part of a medical prescription that gives instructions about the use of the medicine or drug prescribed.
shortDefinitions: part of medical prescription that gives instructions about use of medicine or drug prescribed
